page.title: 03Newspapers _ Ingleton Area
page.content: There are three local papers.They are the Lancaster Guardian, the Craven Herald and the Westmorland Gazette. The Lancaster Guardian mostly covers Lancaster and Morecambe.The Craven Herald mostly covers Skipton.The Westmorland Gazette covers Kendal and the Lake District.There is a local newsletter which is delivered every two months or you can pick it up at the Community Centre.Each week in the local newspaper there is some district news.Ingleton is nearly always mentioned.On March 2nd 1985 there was a Craven Labour Party jumble sale in the Community Centre they raised Â£140 they also held a raffle. A quilting bee is held at the Community Centre once every month.Inglebough WI welcomed Mr Ralph Tomlinson to their February meeting.He showed slides to the meeting about Mount Kilimanjaro.
